result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis John Mackey II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Curtis John Mackey II is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Curtis John Mackey II was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DOC collect costs within the first 6 months after release from custody.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.
Civil judgment for any unpaid financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis John Mackey II

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Defendant completed Challenge Incarceration Program
2/10/21 Pam O'Neal
Revoked - Sentenced to prison (February 10, 2021)

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Sentencing hearing after revocation
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:30 PM Defendant Curtis John Mackey in court byvideo means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video means.  Alexander David Goulart appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Court orders on Count 1 - 2 years and 6 months Wisconsin State Prison and 4 years Extended Supervision, civil judgment for any unpaid financial obligations, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, eligible for Substance and Challenge Programs, 139 days sentence credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 10, 2021 at 01:30 pm.
Ryan O'Hara
Kelly Mattingly
Kelly Mattingly

records.addlTxt: Defendant Curtis John Mackey in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Gwanny J Tjoa appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 and 3 dismissed.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on probation for 4 years consecutive to current sentence.  DOC collect costs within first 6 months of release from custody.  Any AODA treatment required.  No credit.
